history.content: The rules are different for CS vs. EECS. You will need to talk to your college. Assuming you're over 136 units at the end of your 5th semester, I believe a Dean would need to approve this.

children.subject: Does that mean I have to do my study abroad in my 6th semester, not the 5th one?

I did exactly as you described and now I’m in my fifth semester. My majors are Math and CS (BA) and I talked with L&S advisors about that and Ge the answer that you can do a study abroad for your sixth semester but you can’t let them extend your graduation date for study abroad and then stay at cal. 
You need to get approval from L&S advisor first for extending to the sixth semester and then go talk to a study abroad advisor about this. Fill an application for the school you want to goto and then get approval from study abroad advisor. Take that approval to L&S to officially extend your graduation date.
Hope this helps.

history.content: Hi, everyone, I'm a junior transfer student majoring in CS. I want to double major CS and STAT for now. So, I know I'll get 5th semester automatically as long as I don't pass 136 units in my 4th semester. But I'm also very desired for a studying abroad experience. So, I'm wondering if I plan to study abroad in my 5th semester and come back to Berkeley in my last semester(6th) to finish my double major degree. Would this be possible? I heard different rumors from other people. Some said it would be immediately granted, some said maybe not. Could anyone give me some guides here? Appreciate!
history.subject: Would 6th semester be granted(as transfer student) if studying abroad one semester?
